name: Arab World Institute
description: (MF) History, ancient and medieval archeology, arts and crafts, ethnographic and contemporary art of the countries of the Arab world

name: Archaeological Crypt of the Paris Notre-Dame
description: (VP) Remains under Notre Dame de Paris of buildings dating back to the city's early days

name: Art Ludique
description: Exhibitions of contemporary art in comic books, manga, cinema, live animation and videogames

name: Bibliothèque-Musée de l'Opéra National de Paris
description: Library and museum about the Paris Opera, part of the Music Department of the National Library of France

name: Bibliothèque Polonaise de Paris
description: Includes three small museums about Polish natives: Musée Adam Mickiewicz about the poet, Musée Boleslas Biegas with paintings and sculpture by the artist and other Polish artists, and Salon Frédéric Chopin about the composer

name: Cabinet des Médailles
description: Located in the Bibliothèque nationale de France, includes coins, medals, antiques from the ancient Near East, Greece, Rome, and national antiquities

name: Catacombes de Paris
description: (VP) Underground ossuary with the remains of over six million people

name: Cité de l'Architecture et du Patrimoine
description: Located in the Palais de Chaillot, includes Musée national des Monuments Français with plaster casts of French architecture, gallery of reproduced wall paintings and stained-glass windows from historic monuments, French and international architecture from 1850 to the present

name: Cité des Sciences et de l'Industrie
description: Hands-on science exhibits, includes the French submarine Argonaute (S636)

name: Cité nationale de l'histoire de l'immigration
description: (MF) History and culture of immigration in France from the 19th century to the present, located in the Palais de la Porte Dorée

name: Espace Dalí
description: Life of and sculptures, engravings and paintings of Salvador Dali

name: Espace Fondation EDF
description: website, new media exhibitions and exhibitions about society and culture

name: Fondation Cartier pour l'Art Contemporain
description: Contemporary art

name: Fondation Custodia
description: Frits Lugt collection of European drawings, prints, paintings, books and artists' letters from the 15th to 19th century, focusing on Dutch and Flemish Old Masters, Italian and French artists

name: Fondation Jean Dubuffet
description: Works by Jean Dubuffet, also main museum in Périgny, Val-de-Marne

name: Fondation Louis Vuitton
description: Contemporary art

name: Gaîté Lyrique
description: (VP premises) Digital art and culture center

name: Galerie des Gobelins
description: Exhibitions of Gobelins tapestries

name: Galerie nationale du Jeu de Paume
description: (MF) Modern and postmodern photography and media

name: Galeries nationales du Grand Palais
description: Art exhibits and cultural events programmed by the Réunion des musées nationaux et du Grand Palais des Champs-Élysées

name: Henri Cartier-Bresson Foundation
description: website, archives and work of photographers Henri Cartier-Bresson and Martine Franck, exhibitions of other photographers, painters, sculptors, and illustrators

name: Institut Tessin
description: Swedish art and culture

name: La Maison Rouge
description: Exhibits private art collections, monographic shows of contemporary artists' work

name: Maison d'Auguste Comte
description: Restored 19th-century period rooms of positivist philosopher Auguste Comte (1798–1857), one of the 32 Maisons des illustres (fr) in the region Île de France

name: Maison de Balzac
description: (VP) Restored 19th-century rooms with mementos of author novelist Honoré de Balzac

name: Maison européenne de la photographie
description: (VP premises) Contemporary photography

name: Maison de Victor Hugo
description: (VP) Restored 19th-century house of author novelist Victor Hugo

name: Maison La Roche
description: Operated by Fondation Le Corbusier, 1920s house designed by Le Corbusier and Pierre Jeanneret, exhibits art collection and archives of Le Corbusier

name: Maxim's Art Nouveau "Collection 1900"
description: Art Nouveau objects and decor, located above Maxim's restaurant

name: Mémorial de la Shoah
description: History of the Holocaust and French Jews in World War II

name: Minerals collection of Pierre and Marie Curie University
description: website, 1500 minerals on display in 24 display cases

name: Mona Bismarck American Center
description: Exhibitions of American art

name: Mundolingua
description: Information, objects and documents relating to language, linguistic diversity and linguistics

name: Musée – Librairie du Compagnonnage
description: History of French trade guilds, skilled craftsmen in fields such as cooking, pastry, plumbing, ironworks, masonry, cabinetmaking, carpentry

name: Musée Adzak
description: Exhibits paintings, sculpture, and photography by a wide range of artists

name: Musée "Bible et Terre Sainte"
description: Archaeological artifacts arranged to show everyday life in Palestine from 5000 BCE to 600 CE

name: Musée Baccarat
description: Baccarat fine glass work, including vases, dishes and stemware, and limited-edition collections

name: Musée Bourdelle
description: (VP) Sculptures, art and studio of Antoine Bourdelle

name: Musée Carnavalet
description: (VP) City of Paris' history, culture, art, archaeology, decorative arts

name: Musée Cernuschi
description: (VP) Asian art, specializing in works from China, Japan, and Korea

name: Musée Clemenceau
description: Apartment and garden of Georges Clemenceau (1841–1929), French statesman and writer

name: Musée Cognacq-Jay
description: (VP) 18th-century French fine and decorative art

name: Musée Curie
description: History of radiology research and the work of Pierre and Marie Curie

name: Musée d'Art Dentaire Pierre Fauchard
description: Dental history, tools and apparatus

name: Musée d'Art et d'Histoire du Judaïsme
description: Jewish art and history, history of the Jews in France since the Middle Ages and in the communities of Europe and North Africa

name: Musée d'Art Moderne de la Ville de Paris
description: (VP) Modern and Contemporary art of the 20th and 21st centuries

name: Musée d'Art Naïf – Max Fourny
description: (VP premises) Exhibitions of folk art, naive art, and outsider art

name: Musée d'Ennery
description: Asian art with a focus on China and Japan

name: Musée d'Histoire Contemporaine
description: Located in the Hôtel national des Invalides, exhibits of French and international history through its collections of art, photographs, posters, political cartoons and objects

name: Musée d’histoire de la médecine
description: Located at the second floor of the Paris Descartes University, features historic medical instruments and apparatus

name: Musée d'Orsay
description: Mainly French art dating from 1848 to 1914, including paintings, sculptures, furniture, and photography; houses the largest collection of Impressionist and post-Impressionist masterpieces in the world

name: Musée de l'Armée
description: Located in the Hôtel national des Invalides, national military museum of France, includes Musée des Plans-Reliefs, weapons, uniforms, regalia, armor, artillery, Napoleon's Tomb

name: Musée de l'érotisme
description: Erotic art and artifacts from many cultures, contemporary erotic art

name: Musée de l'Éventail
description: Hand fans and fan-making

name: Musée de l'histoire de France
description: Exhibit of documents drawn from the Archives Nationales

name: Musée de l'Homme
description: Human evolution and the history of human sciences

name: Musée de l'Orangerie
description: Gallery of Impressionist and post-Impressionist paintings, features eight Water Lilies murals by Claude Monet

name: Musée de l'Ordre de la Libération
description: Located in the Hôtel national des Invalides, history of the Free French Forces in World War II

name: Musée de la Chasse et de la Nature
description: Sport of hunting, includes hunting weapons, accessories, trophies, art and decorative art, stuffed animal mounts

name: Musée de la Contrefaçon
description: History of counterfeiting objects

name: Musée de la Franc-Maçonnerie
description: History of Freemasonry in France, regalia, artifacts

name: Musée de la Magie
description: Items relating to magic shows, including optical illusions, secret boxes, wind-up toys, magic mirrors, see-through glasses, posters, holds magic shows

name: Musée de la Cinémathèque
description: Part of the Cinémathèque Française, history of film and pre-cinema in France and around the world

name: Musée du 11 Conti - Monnaie de Paris
description: Part of the Monnaie de Paris. Heritage collections, workshops of excellence

name: Musée de la Musique
description: Part of the Cité de la Musique, musical instruments, art

name: Musée de La Poste
description: Postage stamps and postal history of France, currently closed for renovation

name: Musée de la Sculpture en Plein Air
description: (VP) Outdoor sculptures from the second half of the twentieth century on display along the banks of the Seine

name: Musée de la Vie Romantique
description: (VP) 19th house with Romantic-period art and decorative art, mementos of author George Sand

name: Musée de Minéralogie
description: Minerals, rocks, ores, gems, artificial minerals

name: Musée de Montmartre
description: (VP premises) Local history through paintings, photographs, posters and manuscripts

name: Musée des Arts Décoratifs
description: Includes decorative arts (furniture, glass, ceramics and more), interior design, fashion, textiles, advertising, graphic arts

name: Musée des Arts et Métiers
description: History of technology and industry, including advances in scientific instruments, materials, energy, mechanics, construction, communication and transport

name: Musée des Arts Forains
description: Funfair objects including amusement rides, fair stalls and restored attractions, merry-go-rounds and carousels, German swings

name: Musée des Collections Historiques de la Préfecture de Police
description: History of policing in France

name: Musée des Égouts de Paris
description: (VP) History of tours of the Paris sewer system, role of sewer workers and methods of water treatment

name: Musée des Lunettes et Lorgnettes Pierre Marly
description: History of eyewear, includes lorgnettes, glasses, telescopes, and binoculars

name: Musée des moulages dermatologiques de l'hôpital Saint-Louis
description: website, part of the historic building of the Hôpital Saint-Louis, features 19th-century wax casts of dermatological problems

name: Musée des Plans-Reliefs
description: Located in the Hôtel national des Invalides, military models of fortified cities created between 1668 and 1870

name: Musée du Barreau de Paris
description: History of the Paris Bar and its lawyers

name: Musée du Fumeur
description: Includes smoking pipes, Egyptian sheeshas, snuffboxes, cigars, tobacco samples, hemp-fiber clothing, etchings, portraits, photographs, videos, and scientific drawings of tobacco plants

name: Musée du Louvre
description: world's largest museum, includes paintings, prints and drawings, sculpture, decorative arts, Egyptian antiquities, Near Eastern antiquities, Greek, Etruscan and Roman antiquities, Islamic art

name: Musée du Général Leclerc de Hauteclocque et de la Libération de Paris – Musée Jean Moulin
description: (VP) History of Maréchal Philippe Leclerc de Hauteclocque, Jean Moulin, a major figure of the French Resistance, and the liberation of Paris in World War II

name: Musée du Luxembourg
description: Changing exhibitions of art

name: Musée du Parfum Fragonard
description: History and process of perfume, antique perfume bottles, containers, toiletry sets, 19th-century period rooms

name: Musée du quai Branly
description: Indigenous art and cultures of Africa, Asia, Oceania, and the Americas

name: Musée du Service de Santé des Armées [fr]
description: website, history of medical care for armed services in France

name: Musée du Service des Objets Trouvés
description: Items that have ended up in the Lost and Found department of the Paris Police

name: Musée du Vin
description: History of the French craft of winemaking, includes tools and objects used to work the grapevine and the wine, a wine cellar, cooperage

name: Musée Édith Piaf
description: Life of singer Édith Piaf

name: Musée Edouard Branly
description: Life of radio pioneer Édouard Branly, includes his research laboratory and equipment, open by appointment

name: Musée en Herbe
description: Art museum for children

name: Musée Grévin
description: Scenes from the history of France and modern life

name: Musée Jacquemart-André
description: 19th-century period house with major art collection

name: Musée Maillol
description: Works by Aristide Maillol and art exhibitions

name: Musée Marmottan Monet
description: Features over three hundred Impressionist and Post-Impressionist works by Claude Monet, other Impressionist and Post-Impressionist art, illuminated manuscripts, Napoleonic era art and furniture, Italian and Flemish primitive paintings

name: Musée Moissan
description: Open by appointment, life of Henri Moissan (1852–1907), winner of the 1906 Nobel Prize in chemistry

name: Musée National d'Art Moderne
description: Located at the Centre Georges-Pompidou, modern and contemporary art

name: Musée national de la Légion d'Honneur et des Ordres de Chevalerie
description: History of France's honors, medals, decorations, and knightly orders from Louis XI to the present, including Napoleonic souvenirs and more than 300 portraits

name: Musée national de la Marine
description: Includes ship model, maritime art, artifacts, photos

name: Musée national des Arts asiatiques-Guimet
description: Asian art, also known as Musée Guimet

name: Musée national du Moyen Âge
description: Formerly Musée de Cluny, Medieval art, houses six The Lady and the Unicorn tapestries, remnants of the third century Gallo-Roman baths

name: Musée national Eugène Delacroix
description: Life and works of Eugène Delacroix

name: Musée national Gustave Moreau
description: Home and studio of Symbolist painter Gustave Moreau (1826-1898)

name: Musée national Jean-Jacques Henner
description: House and works of painter Jean-Jacques Henner (1829–1905)

name: Musée Nissim de Camondo
description: Museum of French decorative arts displayed as in a wealthy private home

name: Musée Pasteur
description: Life of scientist Louis Pasteur

name: Musée Picasso
description: Life and work of artist Pablo Picasso, also works by Cézanne, Degas, Rousseau, Seurat, de Chirico and Matisse, Iberian bronzes, African art

name: Musée Pierre Cardin
description: website, over 250 Haute Couture designs from 1950 to 2000 designed by Pierre Cardin

name: Musée Rodin
description: Works of the French sculptor Auguste Rodin, located in the Hôtel Biron

name: Musée Valentin Haüy
description: History of the blind and of the methods that gave them access to culture

name: Musée Yves Saint Laurent Paris
description: website, opening in 2017, operated by the Fondation Pierre Bergé – Yves Saint Laurent, works by fashion designer Yves Saint Laurent

name: Musée Zadkine
description: (VP) House and work of sculptor Ossip Zadkine (1890–1967)

name: Muséum national d'Histoire naturelle
description: Includes galleries for minerals and gems, fossils and dinosaurs and comparative anatomy, and the Grand Gallery of Evolution

name: Palais de la Découverte
description: Includes interactive exhibits for mathematics, physics, astronomy, chemistry, geology and biology

name: Palais de Tokyo
description: Modern and contemporary art

name: Palais Galliera
description: (VP) Also known as Musée de la Mode et du Costume de la Ville de Paris, fashion and fashion history, includes exhibits of French fashion design and costume from the eighteenth century to the present; closed between exhibitions

name: Pavillon de l'Arsenal
description: (VP premises) Architecture and urban planning

name: Pavillon de l'eau
description: (VP premises) History of the city's water supply

name: Petit Musée de l'Argenterie
description: Decorative arts made of silver

name: Petit Palais
description: (VP) Paintings, sculpture, Ancient Greek and Roman art, Renaissance art and artifacts, 17th, 18th and 19th century art and artifacts, art from the Western and Eastern Christian worlds, engravings and drawings, photography

name: Salle des Traditions de la Garde Républicaine
description: History of the Garde Républicaine

name: Tenniseum
description: Part of Roland Garros Stadium

name: Théâtre-Musée des Capucines
description: Perfume

name: Tour Jean-sans-Peur
description: History of the medieval tower and medieval Paris

name: World Heritage Centre
description: Tours of the UNESCO headquarters
